document_data.name: Narlen Darkwalk
document_data.mainbody:
'''Narlen Darkwalk''' was a member of the thieves' guild that operated in [[Baldur's Gate]] during the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]].
{{Quote|Split the gemmies thrice, and tonight we'll suck the monkey a keg apiece tavern-wise!|Narlen, after a successful jewel heist.}}
document_data.Description: He had a very unique style of speech that was fairly close to [[Thieves' cant]].
document_data.Relationships: Narlen operated under the leadership of none other than [[Alatos Thuibuld|Alatos "Ravenscar" Thuibuld]].
document_data.History:
In the {{yearlinkName|1368}}, Narlen had planned a heist to break into a noble estate in the [[Baldur's Gate/Upper City|Upper City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] along with another thief named [[Rededge]]. The pair were in need of a trustworthy lookout.

Some time later he also heard rumors about a ''[[rogue stone]]'' being transported from [[Waterdeep]] to the home of a man named [[Gandolandan]], and had the intent of stealing it.
